com.engine.world

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engine.coreObject.CoreObject
      • com.engine.world.Tile

  • public class Tile
extends CoreObject

    Tile

    A Tile is a physical tile in the project World. Tiles have different textures and properties and they are what make up the world.

    Tile Features:

    • All the features of a basic CoreObject.
    • All tiles in a world have the same width.
    • All tiles in a world have the same height.
    • A tile has a map color. This is used to distinguish different tile types from one another on a tile map or a world template.


    Author:
    Ryan Hochmuth

      • clicked

        public void clicked()

        WORK IN PROGRESS

        When a tile is clicked on it updates the 8 surrounding tiles. Currently the tile that was clicked on is also destroyed. NOTE: The updating of the 8 surrounding tiles isn't currently working properly as of v1.1.
        Overrides:
        clicked in class CoreObject

      • checkCollision

        public void checkCollision()
        A basic Tile should not check for collisions. This is being overridden so when it is called, an empty method is ran so no collisions are checked.
        Overrides:
        checkCollision in class CoreObject
